|Title=Modensitometry of a chronic HSD
|Description=None
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=15}}
<gallery widths="300" heights="300">
File:HSD chronic02.png
</gallery>Injection-free CT scan showing a peri-cerebral collection in the left hemispheric convexity (arrows), mostly hypo-dense, in the shape of a "crescent moon" (concave medially and convex laterally): chronic subdural haematoma. Note the additional presence of a few spontaneously hyper-dense areas within the chronic subdural haematoma, indicating the presence of a recent rebleed.

question.question: What does the presence of spontaneously hyper-dense areas within a chronic subdural haematoma indicate?
question.option_a: It indicates the presence of a recent infection.
question.option_b: It indicates the presence of a recent rebleed.
question.option_c: It indicates the presence of a tumor.
question.option_d: It indicates the presence of a chronic infection.
